RM6071.,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Awarded,2020-07-02T11:21:26Z,"Print Marketplace","Crown Commercial Service (CCS) has established a Framework Contract with a single Supplier to provide, host and manage a system known as Print Marketplace.
• service the high-volume, low-spend print requirements across the public sector
• enable public sector Buyers with access to a pre-qualified, dynamic and local supplier base
• offer real-time instant pricing across the print landscape.
The Supplier will provide a full end to end service including the management of: the system, the print
supply chain and Buyer registrations and support.
CCS has partnered with YPO to put this Framework Contract in place.

The full requirements are set out in Attachment 10 Framework Schedule 5 (Specification), in the ITT.",,,"Any region","22000000 30197630 30197640 30197643 30197645 30211300 79800000 ","The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service (CCS)",supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"9th Floor, The Capital Building, Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,L39PP,England,"+44 3450103503",https://www.crowncommercial.gov.uk/,"OJEU Contract Notice Transparency Information for Crown Commercial Service Framework Agreement.docx Redacted Print Marketplace Framework Contract.pdf Print Marketplace Call Off Terms v1.pdf ","https://crowncommercialservice.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html https://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:063410-2020:TEXT:EN:HTML ","This Framework Contract RM6071 Print Marketplace is for use by Contracting Authorities in the United Kingdom that exist on 05/02/2020 and which fall into one or more of the following categories:
(d) Non-Departmental Public Bodies (NDPBs), including advisory NDPBs, executive NDPBs, and tribunal NDPBs

(k) Educational bodies or establishments including state schools (nursery schools, primary schools, middle or high schools, secondary schools, special schools), academies, colleges, Pupil Referral Unit (PRU), further education colleges and universities
(n) Housing associations, including registered social landlords
(q) Councils, including county councils, district councils, county borough councils, community councils, London borough councils, unitary councils, metropolitan
(v) Civil service bodies, including public sector buying organisations.
2. Those listed and maintained by the Government on their website at
https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations or any replacement or updated web-link
3. Those listed and maintained by the Office of National Statistics (ONS) at
https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/nationalaccounts/uksectoraccounts/datasets/publicsectorclassificationguide or any replacement or updated web-link.

4. Those bodies in England, Wales or Northern Ireland which are within the scope of the definition of ""Contracting Authority"" in regulation 2(1) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR) and/or Schedule 1 PCR.",16/06/2020,16/06/2024,06/03/2020,YES,RM6071.,Yes,No,No,Services,200000000,,16/06/2020,200000000,"[Allied Publicity Services (Manchester) Ltd|Bird Hall Lane, Cheadle
